revised_title: Investigating the Spectrum of Carbonic Acid: A Study on the Influence of Dryness and Vacuum Conditions
tldr: The author investigates the spectrum of carbonic acid under various dryness and vacuum conditions. The experiments reveal that Swan's spectrum cannot be solely attributed to hydrocarbon, and the phenomenon shown by sparks is not as convincing. The author also observes a new line spectrum when the density of the gas is increased.
